intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium murorum subsp. subsemisilvularum, commonly known as the woodland hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish-orange composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. This subspecies typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. The plant is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is adapted to thrive in partial to full shade.
